column4: Has anybody else had a problem with LTS knocking out working eth0 from Breezy? I.e. losing wired internet after updating.
no eth) problems here (But I updated from flight7, not breezy)
I had it work fine on one box and not on the other. Weird thing is I've never had trouble with eth on Ubuntu before.
try this in a terminal --> ifdown eth0 ; ifup eth0
it restarts the networking
ping
still here?
No luck. I'm noogetting a DHCPDiscover. I'm guessing it must be a config file but don't know where to start looking. I am getting a problem with postconf as part of the ifdown or network restart
-- it looks like dhcp is not there
do you have a router?
yes. The problem is that it isn't receiving a DHCP offer. And if I give it a fixed IP I still get nothing.
okay -- you can only give it a static IP if you are behind a router -- assuming you are -- you'll need to put in DNS too, did you do that?
there was an entry already: it points to the router. Right now I'm still looking for dhcp, since that's what I've always done and since it only caused problems after the upgrade.
good -- the dns server should ususally point to the router -- but for dhcp -- try the following in a terminal ans pastebin it's output
find /usr/sbin -name '*dhcp*'
sorry -- that won't work
nothing came anyway.
From here I don;t know what to say except make sure it's plugged in.
you might try unplugging and plugging back in the router..
Checked if it was plugged in first ;). The router is working, since two other computers are running through it: one wireless and one wired.
I know it's wprking but I'd reset it anyway
